body:
I have now tested Java Shell both with and without the patch; there seems to be no changes in behavior that I have managed to observed (testing Home/End/Up/Down).

I also tested the case where the current Java Shell prompt line is in fact being wrapped; no new bugs that I could see are being introduced in this case. Here, Home/End/Up/Down seem to work a little differently than in the regular editor, but that was the case before the patch as well.

I think this patch as well as https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/603 is ready now. I have not been able to find any new bugs or test failures introduced by them.

It might be a good general policy to always require at least a cursory review of new commits by someone else than the original author. But there are no blockers from my point of view.

@geertjanw I think @sdedic wanted me to take a slightly more conservative approach in case there are platform apps that might be affected by the modified behavior. I can make a new patch when I find some time...

@matthiasblaesing Thanks for you comments!

What's the ant target to validate licence files? It would be neat if it was documented somewhere...
@junichi11 Great! BTW the file cannot be downloaded to a temporary file? If not, then it is pity. Of course, the question is whether a test should not be able to run offline only.

> BTW the file cannot be downloaded to a temporary file?

e.g. we download test data as external binaries, don't we? I'm not sure but I suppose that we can include removed files again without doing that if their licenses are compatible with ALv2. So I'll try to verify them once later. I've submitted this problem to the JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-1151
OK, I see. Thanks.
Thanks, merging.
Feel free to merge.
Thanks, merging.

Category A would only required if the files should be under version control - if not, all licenses are good, as the ASFs requirement is only relevant for the created artifacts. You can use the GPL licensed gcc at build-time, but you may not depend on it after the build is done. So if at build/test time resources are used for unittesting, I don't see why this would not be ok. As the context is PHP - it should be possible to find PHP licensed files, that match the requirements.

Here's the same process for the new groovy subdirectory, the build succeeds, though I imagine Travis may fail and that something may need to be tweaked there: https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/725

The validation can be invoked via:

```
ant -Dcluster.config=full verify-all-libs-and-licenses
```

this will download all external binaries (`verify-all-libs-and-licenses`) and validate all licenses (the `full` cluster should include all modules).

The result is then written to: `nbbuild/build/verifylibsandlicenses.xml`

I see. Thanks for your explanation!
I try to add removed files, then create a new PR. If there are problems, I fix them there.

I'll merge this PR.
Seems to have passed all checks and balances. :-) Maybe we should simply merge this?
Thanks for identifying this, will investigate.

> the change was cosmetic (display in github)

No, that's not true: https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/536

I did not want to discuss #536 - but quote from #536 (no other reasons are given there):

> Recently two new cons appeared:
> 
>- github isn't willing to show the whole repository - it limits the list to just a thousand files
>- new modules are (hopefully) going to be granted by Oracle and not all of them are of the same importance

this qualifies for me as "no technical need". I can live with the PR, but it needs more work and we are now seeing the fallout.

Sure, I agree with you (though I do think the reasons for this are going to be increasingly valid as more and more modules are added, i.e., who will then understand what's going on without some kind of subcategorization?). Good this is not merged yet. But is the same problem apparent in the already merged platform reorganization? Probably all this went too fast, apologies for that, and thanks again for spotting the fallout.

Ok - two observations: the downloads tasks (called from `nbbuild/build.xml`) makes assumptions about the directory layout, that are not valid anymore. The same is true for `VerifyLibsAndLicenses`.

The platform cluster is currently unchecked for license problems - but if I'm not mistaken, that was already done. Anyway - once we fix the build, we can just run another verification build.

OK, fair enough. We need to work on these parts before merging anything else related to this change. I want to apologize again for this significant change happening via pull requests rather than much discussion (though to be fair there was a thread by @jtulach on the dev mailing list though admittedly probably too briefly before merging the platform part of this).

@geertjanw no need to apologize - I think we all have the same aim: Having a great netbeans and an easier time working with the repository. We might not always agree on the "right" way, but the intention is the same :-)

Instead of adding a global rat exclude, other javascript modules were modified to contain a `licenseinfo.xml` file. This approach has the benefit, that the license situation is clear and a list of files can be created from that. See here:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/709/files

@junichi11 determined, that neighter .bowerrc, nor bower.json supported comments and so they can't hold that info, but with the info in the created `licenseinfo.xml`, a third party reviewer, can:

a) verify the license (see license/ref)
b) see the reason (comment/type)

when creating a rat report, files covered by licenseinfo.xml are excluded from the report and a summary is created as `rat-appendix.txt`, that gives a details report about these files.

@geertjanw could you please have a look, this implements the first changes necessary as indicated in #725 

@jtulach could please evaluate if you can identify further tasks, that need adjustments after your changeset for the per cluster subdirectory change in #536? It would be great if you could check the nbbuild project, as `FixTestDependenciesTest` is still broken, because you changed the constructor of `org.netbeans.nbbuild.ModuleListParser.Entry`
Just checking -- what's wrong with javahelp being in platform?

Nothing is wrong with that - but the reference from the nbbuild project needs to be adjusted for the moved path - before the change in line 208:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/blob/3a6f41789456fd1473163b1ac9e4e6616436c61b/nbbuild/nbproject/project.xml#L208

the reference pointed to a non-existing file after the cluster reorgnisation of platform.

Result of `ant -Dcluster.config=full verify-libs-and-licneses`:
```
libs.nashorn/external/com.oracle.js.parser-license.txt must end in a newline
libs.nashorn/external/com.oracle.js.parser-license.txt is missing a required header: Origin
libs.nashorn/external/com.oracle.js.parser-license.txt does not contain the version ba7a8bc42268 in its name
libs.nashorn/external/com.oracle.js.parser-license.txt has a GPL-family license but is either not covered by the Classpath Exception, or is not compile-time/optional only.
libs.nashorn/external/com.oracle.js.parser-license.txt contains a license body which does not match that in nbbuild/licenses/GPL-2-CP: mismatch around: '(C) 1989, 1991 Free ' vs. '1989, 1991 Free Soft'
libs.nashorn/external/com.oracle.js.parser.jar does not appear to include a version number
```

The license is GPL-2-CP. So, we cannot include this?
So, with your (great) changes now merged, can this one be merged too, i.e., there shouldn't be problems anymore with this PR, AFAIK.

Folks, this will not be that easy. Nashorn binary needs to be distributed, since it is used at runtime, but uses `GPLv2+CPE` license, which is not compatible with Apache distribution AFAIK.

I would separate two issues: cleaning up / fixing license so that the code may reside in the repository. This is what this PR is about. Other code can compile against the nashorn classes (compile-time dependency), but that code will not actually run.

I filed issue [NETBEANS-1159](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-1159) to explore possible relicensing from the contributor (Oracle). In the meantime, approach similar to NB javac could be used, as the code **can** (IMHO, IANAL) be legally compiled AND distributed, though not using Apache mirrors. See [NETBEANS-1160](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-1160).

Your commit message says (https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/743/commits):
"Add licenseinfor file with media"

It should say: "[NETBEANS-1074] Module Review web.debug" as the PR does.

The commit message survives for the future, the PR is temporary. In general I expect a git commit message:

- first line should hold a short summary of the changes (< 70 characters)
- if a jira issue is referenced, place "[_JIRA-ISSUE_] " before the summary in the first line (just as you did in the PR message)
- If there is context information available: Why was the change done, what are the consequences, which testing was done, place that as text starting in line 3

This way, even years later others can find the referenced issues, understand what you did with a quick glance and get detailed information with a deeper look, without guessing from the change itself.

For the license changes this is not that important, but it get important if you do subtle changes for example for the java parser, xml handling, editor behaviour and so on.

Hope that clears it a bit.
Great, merging.

I'll update VerifyLibsAndLicenses to correctly handle GPL for external binaries, that are compile-time only - give me a few days to do that.

For the performance.php: It would be great if you could see if using a different file is possible. I had a quick(!)  look at the SMF sources and there is `/Sources/Subs.php` in [SMF 2.0.15](https://download.simplemachines.org/index.php?thanks;filename=smf_2-0-15_install.zip). That are > 4000 lines of PHP code. That file would be IMHO better, because it is pure BSD:

@license http://www.simplemachines.org/about/smf/license.php BSD

so I'd take that file, add a comment where it came from, the license text and you'd be done. I assume here, that this measures the time parsing takes (no I did not look into the usage of the file :-))

I don't quire get what the changes to `html*.php` are about.

> I'll update VerifyLibsAndLicenses to correctly handle GPL for external binaries, that are compile-time only - give me a few days to do that. Thanks a lot! > For the performance.php: It would be great if you could see if using a different file is possible. I had a quick(!) look at the SMF sources and there is /Sources/Subs.php in SMF 2.0.15. That are > 4000 lines of PHP code. That file would be IMHO better, because it is pure BSD: I also looked at it, but I think its size is small against current performance.php(30972 lines, 837 KB) yet. Instead, we should use [nette.min.php](https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/blob/fa0fe898d43e566e78ab60e9da9909631657a15e/php.editor/test/unit/data/testfiles/actions/testImportData/libs/nette.min.php)(New BSD: 22475 lines, 537 KB) or [Mpdf file](https://github.com/mpdf/mpdf/blob/development/src/Mpdf.php)(GPL: 1.01 MB) which Tomas suggested. @tmysik What do you think? If Mpdf file is better, I'll add it as an external file as well. > I don't quire get what the changes to html*.php are about. We can see "Akismet". Those codes may be part of an external script. So, at least we should not include that word. I found out the similar example code here: https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=124273#c0. ```php

``` So it should be OK, maybe. Just used `

` instead of `
`, `echo ""` instead of `$r = 123;`.

I would definitely prefer some really big PHP file. The point is not to measure the time (that would be nice but difficult to "measure") but rather the memory; I mean to "ensure" that NB is still able to parse such a huge file after all the changes and fixes that are done in the PHP editor module.
